page.title: 04FARMING IN BLACKBURN
page.content: Lower Whitehalgh Farm is 185 acres. Mr Shorrock, the farmer, keeps cows and sheep but he doesn't grow any crops. He has 100 cows altogether, most of them are Friesian but he also has 3 Charolais bulls. The biggest bull weighs one and a quarter tons. He has 41 sheep which are pedigree Suffolk. The cows are milked and the milk is kept cool until a tanker comes to collect it. If the milk is not the right temperature, he will not get the proper price for it. Horden Farm covers 70 acres and is a mixed farm, keeping sheep and growing crops. Higher Whitehalgh Farm covers 100 acres and is similar to Lower Whitehalgh Farm in that it keeps dairy cattle and sheep.
